title: Oscillatory Regimes in a Game-Theoretic Model for Mosquito Population Dynamics under Breeding Site Control
summary: This paper introduces a game-theoretic model to analyze how spontaneous household decisions regarding breeding site control influence mosquito population dynamics. It reveals a feedback loop where perceived risks drive household control actions, which in turn regulate the mosquito carrying capacity. A key finding is that when perceived risk depends on mosquito prevalence, the system can exhibit sustained oscillations in both mosquito abundance and household engagement, arising intrinsically from their dynamic interaction via a Hopf bifurcation.

title: FlowLet: Conditional 3D Brain MRI Synthesis using Wavelet Flow Matching
summary: This paper introduces FlowLet, a novel conditional generative framework designed to synthesize age-conditioned 3D Brain MRIs. FlowLet leverages flow matching within an invertible 3D wavelet domain to overcome limitations of existing generative methods, such as slow inference and artifacts from latent compression. The research demonstrates that FlowLet generates high-fidelity volumes efficiently, improving Brain Age Prediction (BAP) model performance for underrepresented age groups and preserving anatomical structures.

title: An interpretable data-driven approach to optimizing clinical fall risk assessment
summary: This study developed an interpretable data-driven approach, Constrained Score Optimization (CSO), to recalibrate the Johns Hopkins Fall Risk Assessment Tool (JHFRAT) for improved fall risk prediction. By reweighting JHFRAT items while preserving its structure and clinical thresholds, the CSO model significantly outperformed the original tool, demonstrating improved predictive performance (AUC-ROC 0.91 vs. 0.86). This enhancement translates to protecting an additional 35 high-risk patients weekly across the health system and provides a robust, interpretable solution for optimizing inpatient fall prevention protocols.

title: SRU-Pix2Pix: A Fusion-Driven Generator Network for Medical Image Translation with Few-Shot Learning
summary: This paper introduces SRU-Pix2Pix, an enhanced Pix2Pix framework designed for medical image translation, specifically addressing MRI limitations like long acquisition times and high costs. By integrating Squeeze-and-Excitation Residual Networks (SEResNet) and U-Net++ into its generator, and employing a simplified PatchGAN discriminator, the model achieves superior image generation quality and structural fidelity. The method demonstrates strong generalization ability and consistent performance in intra-modality MRI translation tasks under few-shot learning conditions.

title: SciIF: Benchmarking Scientific Instruction Following Towards Rigorous Scientific Intelligence
summary: This paper introduces SciIF, a novel multi-discipline benchmark designed to rigorously evaluate Large Language Models' (LLMs) ability for "scientific instruction following." SciIF assesses LLMs' adherence to strict scientific constraints across conditions, semantics, and processes, demanding explicit evidence of compliance to ensure auditable and reliable scientific intelligence beyond mere final-answer correctness.

title: Smart IoT-Based Wearable Device for Detection and Monitoring of Common Cow Diseases Using a Novel Machine Learning Technique
summary: This paper proposes an IoT-enabled Cyber-Physical System with a wearable device to automate the detection and monitoring of common cow diseases, addressing the limitations of labor-intensive and inaccurate manual observation. It introduces a novel Machine Learning algorithm designed to simultaneously diagnose multiple diseases using collected physiological and behavioral data, aiming for high prediction accuracy and reduced operational costs.

title: DB-MSMUNet:Dual Branch Multi-scale Mamba UNet for Pancreatic CT Scans Segmentation
summary: This paper introduces DB-MSMUNet, a novel dual-branch multi-scale Mamba UNet architecture, for accurate segmentation of the pancreas and its lesions in CT scans. The model effectively addresses challenges like low contrast and blurry boundaries by integrating multi-scale state space modeling, deformable convolutions, a dual-decoder with edge and area enhancement paths, and auxiliary deep supervision. Experiments on three datasets demonstrate that DB-MSMUNet achieves state-of-the-art Dice Similarity Coefficients, enhancing segmentation accuracy, edge preservation, and robustness for pancreatic cancer diagnosis and treatment.

title: SpeechMedAssist: Efficiently and Effectively Adapting Speech Language Models for Medical Consultation
summary: SpeechMedAssist proposes a novel two-stage training paradigm for Speech Language Models (SpeechLMs) to enable efficient and effective speech-based multi-turn medical consultations. By decoupling knowledge injection from modality re-alignment, the approach significantly reduces the need for medical speech data to just 10k synthesized samples. The model demonstrates superior performance over baselines in both effectiveness and robustness across various evaluation settings on a newly designed medical consultation benchmark.

title: AgentDevel: Reframing Self-Evolving LLM Agents as Release Engineering
summary: Recent progress in large language model (LLM) agents has largely focused on embedding self-improvement mechanisms inside the agent or searching over many concurrent variants.
